isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: MIDLAND MODELS EL-1300 AND EL-1600 - CLEAN, INSPECT AND REPAIR - PISTONS

svcproc.title: PISTONS
svcproc.para: Inspect pistons for damage, such as cracks or scoring.

step1.para: Measure outside diameter of both pistons just below the compression ring grooves, then compare this diameter with inside diameter of respective cylinder bore. Be sure to measure the piston at a 90 degree angle to piston pin bore to insure correct measurement.

Piston to bore clearance should not exceed .008 inch (0.20 mm). If clearance exceeds .008 inch (0.20 mm), replace the piston. Also the block must be replaced or bored oversize to 0.020 inch (.508 mm). Pistons with 0.020 inch (.508 mm) oversize are available for the EL- 1300 and EL-1600 air compressors.

Piston pins must have a light interference fit in piston and a slip fit in the rod. Piston pins that have a variation in diameter of more than .003 inch (.076 mm) must be replaced. If the piston pin bore or rod bore is worn, the complete piston and rod assembly must be replaced.

Check fit of compression and oil rings in the piston ring grooves. Place rings in piston ring grooves and measure side clearance. Place rings in respective cylinder bore and measure ring gap as shown ( Figure 13). If measurements are not within SPECIFICATIONS, replace the rings.
